Specific Themed Retreats

A few suggestions...

These are a few suggestions, and are available for any date that you book unless otherwise specified. Alternatively you're welcome to request a subject or theme of your own.

  • Monday 13th – Friday 17th July: “A beautiful mess” art week, in conjunction with Green Pastures retreat centre and Gill Buckley, inspired by Daniel Strickland’s book “A beautiful mess”.

    This five day retreat will take place in Branksome, Dorset, within easy reach of the beach.  A range of artistic media will be on offer; glass appliqué, painting, collage, photography and even floristry. For bookings, please contact Green Pastures direct, on 01202 764776, or e-mail info@green-pastures.org

    http://www.green-pastures.org/#!A-Beautiful-Mess-Art-week/cvh6/i683w1jf80

  • Friday 4th September – Sunday 6th September:  A time of fruitfulness.

    As harvest time hopefully draws near, take time to reflect on what you’ve done with your talents so far and which gifts you could do more with. Stretch your creative “muscle” and explore a range of glass techniques, decorating a mirror using the copper foil technique or glass appliqué.

  • Friday 9th – Sunday 11th October: Leaded designs, ancient and modern.

    Choose your favourite hymn or song and translate it into a leaded glass design. (Tip: “There is a green hill far away” or “Away in a manger” might be easier than “We are marching” or “I surrender”!) Alternatively, choose a classic leaded light design from the last two centuries as your inspiration.

    Your finished glass panel will be suitable for hanging or standing in a window, to show off your talents.

  • Creation and Creativity.

    Take time to reflect on all that God has created, including ourselves, and give time and your talents back to Him. During this retreat you can craft a mirror  with a decorative frame, using copper foil.

  • Broken glass, broken lives: Making something beautiful out of the pieces.

    Often it is in the dark times and the struggles that God transforms us the most. Allow Him to work in and through you as you take pieces of broken glass and turn them into a beautiful glass appliqué picture.

  • St. Patrick’s Breastplate.

    Bind unto yourself this day the strong name of the Trinity, as we look at this famous prayer. Work with lead and glass over the course of two days or more to create your own decorative panel to remind you of God’s care for you and His hand on your life.
